title: (x) Freeware script font used in signature for message board - Forelle {Florian, Satya}
content:
Hi,

I made this image as a signature for a message board, but I need to redo it because it turns out I was mistaken about having permission to use the background. Unfortunately I can’t remember what font I used for my name (“Michelle”). I know I got it from some free font site, or else it was already installed on my computer. (I am using a new computer now, of course. Sigh.) It can’t be too uncommon a font since I am usually too lazy to look very long for a font I like.

Oh, the drop shadow is not part of the font; I added that. I really appreciate any help you can give me!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cm_aisling_5987.png)

 [‹ DA Designer signage (tiny sample)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030/http:/typophile.com/node/39319 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fonts in Cadbury commercial - Hanseatic, Sauna {Mikey D} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030/http:/typophile.com/node/39384 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sioleabha

comments.content:
Hi Michelle,  
that’s Forelle, a script face by Erich Mollowitz from 1936. There’s a [commercial version by Mecanorma](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/f/forelle.htm) and a [free one by Dieter Steffmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/f/forelle.htm).  
F
Oh, yes, it is!! Thank you so much — you rock!

P.S.: And then there’s a similar one, [Jaunty Gent](http://web.archive.org/web/20071231134030/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jaunty-gent-nf/) by typophile Nick Curtis, based on a variation called Rheingold (Afaik, MyFonts is wrong here, it’s _not_Rhein **h** old).
